node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Found Not Guilty of Homicide by Kenosha Jury
node.alt: Kyle Rittenhouse is sworn in before testifying in his trial at the Kenosha County Courthouse on November 10, 2021 in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
node.description: Rittenhouse fatally shot two men and wounded a third during social protests in Kenosha, Wisconsin, in 2020. He pleaded not guilty to all charges.
node.content:
["A jury in Kenosha County, Wisconsin, found Kyle Rittenhouse not guilty of homicide Friday in the deaths of Joseph Rosenbaum and Anthony Huber, whom the 17-year-old fatally shot on August 25, 2020.", "The jury also found Rittenhouse, now 18, not guilty for attempted first-degree intentional homicide in the shooting of Gaige Grosskreutz, who was struck in the bicep and wounded.", "The verdict was delivered on the fourth day of jury deliberations.", "Rittenhouse had been charged with five felony counts, including intentional, reckless and attempted homicide, as well as reckless endangerment.", "He had also faced a misdemeanor charge of possession of a dangerous person by a minor\u2014a charge dismissed by the judge on Monday.", "", "
Kyle Rittenhouse is sworn in before testifying in his trial at the Kenosha County Courthouse on November 10, 2021 in Kenosha, Wisconsin.
", "Rittenhouse had pleaded not guilty to all charges.", "The jury, which was assembled after a single day of jury selection, consisted of 11 women and eight men. Ultimately, twelve served on the panel, while the other seven were considered to be alternates.", "Throughout the trial, Rittenhouse contended that he acted in self-defense last summer when he fatally shot Rosenbaum and Huber and injured Grosskreutz.", "The 18-year-old said he had traveled to Kenosha, Wisconsin from his hometown of Antioch, Illinois to help protect local businesses that had been destroyed or looted amid the unrest that followed the police shooting of Jacob Blake.", "Rittenhouse, who took the stand himself on Wednesday, told the jury: \"I didn't do anything wrong. I defended myself.\"", "The teen was notably overcome with emotion during his testimony, forcing the courtroom to break for a brief recess after he began hyperventilating on the stand.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
